agent_wrapup_time.description: Pre-defined wait period applied after an agent handles a customer call (in seconds)
agent_wrapup_time.name: Agent Wrapup Time

force_away_on_reject.description: If set to true and a recipient rejects a call, they will be forced to away state

hold_treatment.description: Media ID (or appropriate media URI) of media to play while caller is on hold.
hold_treatment.name: Hold Treatment

primary_node.description: The full node name of the Erlang node that should be the primary for this queue.
primary_node.name: Primary Node

queue_name.description: A friendly name for the queue
queue_name.name: Name

queue_router.description: The queue router used for routing and delivering calls to recipients
queue_router.name: Router

ring_timeout.description: Amount of time in seconds that qubicle will wait while ringing for the agent to successfully answer a call.
ring_timeout.name: Agent Connect Timeout

tick_time.description: The time between delivery ticks in milliseconds
tick_time.name: Tick Time

timeout.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that a call will wait in queue.
timeout.name: Queue Timeout

timeout_if_size_exceeds.description: If set to a non-zero value the queue will immediately time out any call entering the queue over the size

timeout_immediately_if_empty.description: If set to true and a call enters the queue while it has no logged in agents, the call will time out

timeout_redirect.description: The ID of a queue that the call will be sent to in the event of a timeout
